item.title: Engine Indication and Crew Alerting Systems (EICAS) – Display Unit (DU)

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, one may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Standby Engine Instruments are operative and turned ON,
Cargo FIRE/OVHT test is performed before each departure,
Electronic Engine Control or autothrottle system is operative,
At least one autopilot is operative,
All EICAS computers are operative, and
Repair or replacements are made within one flight day.

note.para: In event of an additional DU failure en route, flight crew should consider landing as soon as practical.

numlitem.para: For engine start, monitor normal fuel flow and EGT rise in the compacted mode.
Power setting for takeoff must be made with EICAS.
Use SEI to observe engine parameters.
Prior to descent, scan overhead panel for possible non-normal indications.
Observe EGT Start Limits: (PW) 485°C ground 545°C flight. (RR) 570°C ground and flight.

placard.para: Placard affected display unit (DU) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Pull and collar circuit breakers for affected CRT:
Perform Cargo FIRE/OVHT test prior to each departure.
